communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jean Maria Arrigo
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to Jean Maria Arrigo. She was born on April 30, 1944, in Memphis, Tennessee, USA. She died on February 24, 2024.

ABOUT THE SUBJECT

Dr. Arrigo was a psychologist who blew the whistle on her profession’s secret ties to the torture and abuse of war-on- terror detainees, helping expose collusion between American Psychological Association officials and Defense Department leaders after the terrorist attacks of Sept. 11, 2001.

PROOF OF DEATH

Dr. Arrigo’s news obituary from the Washington Post is attached.

CROSS-REFERENCE SEARCH

Please conduct a cross-reference search of your files on the following people and organizations to see if they contain additional records related to Dr. Arrigo:

(1) American Psychological Association
(2) Coalition for an Ethical Psychology

FEES 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you anticipate that those fees will exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz
